result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda M. Drake was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any sentence currently serving

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.
Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, unless excused by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and follow up, if not already completed.  

DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Linda M. Drake

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  2:02 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Gisselman. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to DRI Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine); COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to Count 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>GUILTY.   

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation; concurrent to any sentence currently serving.  
CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up, if not already completed.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, unless excused by agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  

Adj:  2:13 p.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 2, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Case called: 9:40 a.m.     
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. Defendant appears in person with Atty Linda Drake.  
Date and time set for review hearing.

Atty Gisselman advises defendant is will to move forward to waive prelim today.
COURT questions deft as to waiver and performs colloquy. 
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 
Plea >>NOT GUILTY.  

Next Hearing >> PTC 8/02/22 at 3:15 p.m.

Prior: 6300 Birch Street #153, Weston, WI 54476 

Deft called to update address and confirm phone number

Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Preliminary Hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:40 am.

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
